metadata.feature_description: Wiki functionality within DNN social groups with group-specific content

steps.action: Navigate to Groups page and create Wiki Test Group with Wiki feature enabled
steps.expected: Group is created with Wiki tab available
steps.actual: Wiki Test Group created successfully with Wiki tab visible in group space

steps.action: Click on Wiki tab and click Create article
steps.actual: Create article dialog displayed with title, content, tags fields

steps.action: Fill in article title, content, and tags, then publish
steps.actual: Article 'Group Wiki Test Article' published with content and tags (group-wiki, test, social)

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki tab in group to view article list
steps.actual: Article list shows 'Group Wiki Test Article' with last updated time, summary, and tags

steps.action: Verify article content is accessible within group context
steps.expected: Article content displays correctly with group context (groupid in URL)
steps.actual: Article displayed at URL /Community/Groups/Wiki/groupid/10/Group-Wiki-Test-Article with full content

steps.action: Access Group Features settings via + tab
steps.expected: Group features dialog shows configurable options including Wiki
steps.actual: Group Features dialog displayed with checkboxes for Activity, Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Members, and Wiki (all checked)

steps.action: Verify group owner and administrator roles
steps.expected: Group has owner and administrator roles visible
steps.actual: Group Owner: SuperUser Account (You), Group Administrators: Anonymous displayed in sidebar

steps.action: Navigate to Notifications page after creating article
steps.actual: Wiki notification displayed: 'Congratulations! You have earned a new Privilege - Create articles' (21 minutes ago)

steps.action: View Activity tab in group space after creating wiki article
steps.expected: Journal entry shows wiki article creation
steps.actual: Activity stream shows: '[Anonymous] authored wiki article Group Wiki Test Article' with content preview, Like, Read More, Comment, Remove options

steps.action: Open Create Group dialog and examine accessibility options
steps.expected: Dialog shows Public and Private group options
steps.actual: Create a Group dialog displays: Public ('The group page is public and anyone who wants to can join instantly') and Private ('Only group members and those who have been invited will be able to view the group page') options

observations: Code review confirmed group-specific article handling via GroupId parameter in ArticleController.Search and ListController.Query methods
RequireGroupModeViewPermission method enforces group access control for wiki content
Journal integration implemented via Journal.Instance.AddWikiToJournal for activity tracking
Subscription system available for wiki article notifications within groups
Private groups restrict wiki content to members only - non-members cannot view group wiki articles
The 'Move article between groups' test scenario was not explicitly tested as there was no visible UI for moving articles between groups in the current implementation
